metadata.Title: CVE-2019-3844 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
It was discovered that a systemd service that uses DynamicUser property canget new privileges through the execution of SUID binaries, which wouldallow to create binaries owned by the service transient group with thesetgid bit set. A local attacker may use this flaw to access resources thatwill be owned by a potentially different service in the future, when theGID will be recycled.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3844` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 237-3ubuntu10.38
libnss-mymachines - 237-3ubuntu10.38
libnss-resolve - 237-3ubuntu10.38
libnss-systemd - 237-3ubuntu10.38
libpam-systemd - 237-3ubuntu10.38
libsystemd0 - 237-3ubuntu10.38
libudev1 - 237-3ubuntu10.38
systemd - 237-3ubuntu10.38
systemd-container - 237-3ubuntu10.38
systemd-coredump - 237-3ubuntu10.38
systemd-journal-remote - 237-3ubuntu10.38
systemd-sysv - 237-3ubuntu10.38
systemd-tests - 237-3ubuntu10.38
udev - 237-3ubuntu10.38
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: systemd package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '237-3ubuntu10.38').
